title: Firefox is not loading MSN Games

title: Two-step authentication in Firefox Account, Invalid two-step authentication code
content:
Dear community,

I've been having trouble logging into a new device with my Firefox account. I have Two-step authentication installed. The steps I have followed are:

1. Go to account settings on a logged in device (windows computer) 2. Generate QR code and scan it with new device (android phone) 3. Enter Two-step authentication code from your app.

This is where it stops working. I open the Google authenticator app on my android phone and enter the code but it doesn't work. I've synchronised for time correction but it says it's already in sync with google servers. What am I doing wrong?
creator: lionvandenbrand

title: Espacio de disco duro lleno durante uso // Hard disk space full during use
content:
Hola buenas, Estoy teniendo un problema mientras uso firefox.

Cuando tengo el Firefox abierto tras un tiempo, el espacio del disco duro se me llena al 100% de espacio. Cuando cierro el Firefox empieza liberarse espacio en el disco duro.

He estado mirando si el problema provenia por la memoria virtual (uso de espacio de disco duro como ram) y no era ese el problema. He mirado la caché y esta establecida por defecto.

Alguien me podria ayudar?? Muchas gracias Un saludo

Hello Hello, I am having a problem while using firefox.

When I have firefox open after a while, my hard disk space fills up to 100% space. When I close firefox it starts freeing up space on the hard drive.

I have been looking to see if the problem was coming from the virtual memory (use of hard disk space as ram) and that was not the problem. I have looked at the cache and it's still there. I have looked at the cache and it is set to default.

Can anyone help me? Thank you very much. Best regards
creator: carloscastromoreno

title: PIV Card with User Certificate .PFX format
content: We want to login web application by selecting the user certificate. Here we are using certificate chain in PKCS #7 format and user Certificate in .pfx format. But when I try to login to the application Mozilla browser is not prompting to select the certificate, where the certificate is stored in the smartcard. It is directly asking for the Smartcard card PIN. When I enter the smartcard PIN it is throwing a error NO CERTIFCATE IS SELECTED and not redirecting to the application.
creator: teja7565

title: Firefox 85.0
content: I have a MacBook Air running MacOS X 10.15.2 Catalina with Intel HD Graphics 6000 and Firefox just updated automatically to 85.0. Since the update, I cannot launch Firefox - it opens and then immediately hangs so I have to do a Force Quit as system says Firefox is not responding. Strangely, if I launch Safari first then launch Firefox, everything is OK even though I do not actively use Safari after it is launched and quit it as soon as Firefox opens. I would prefer not to have to launch Safari before starting my preferred browser. No crashes have been logged because it fails to fully open. Any ideas?
creator: mail918

title: Lightning calendar in the field for the TASKS, ALL TASKS for RECURING TASKS
content:
Hello, After the latest update of Thunderbird, in the Lightning calendar in the field for the TASKS, ALL TASKS for RECURING TASKS for the future and not only for the selected day in the calendar appear. Usually "TODAY" is always marked there. What do I have to do so that only the TASKS up to the marked date appear in the future? Since my knowledge of English is unfortunately not sufficient to describe this complex problem in English, I use the Google translation function and have added the original German text below for explanation. Perhaps that helps to understand the formulation of my request? I would be very happy to hear from you. Kind regards George

Original text in German: Hallo, nach dem neusten Update von Thunderbird, erscheinen im Lightning-Kalender in dem Feld für die AUFGABEN nun auch ALLE AUFGABEN bei WIEDERKEHRENDEN AUFGABEN für die Zukunft und nicht nur für den jeweils gewählten Tag im Kalender. Normalerweise ist dort immer der "HEUTIGE TAG" markiert. Was muss ich tun, damit künftig wieder nur die AUFGABEN bis zum markierten Datum erscheinen? Da meine English-Kenntnisse leider nicht ausreichend sind um dieses komplexe Problem auf English zu beschreiben, nutze ich die Google-Übersetzungsfunktion und habe den deutschen Ursprungstext zur Erläuterung unten angefügt. Vielleicht ist trägt das zum Verständnis der Formulierung meines Anliegens bei? Über eine Antwort würde ich mich sehr freuen. Freundliche Grüße Georg
creator: tomsb

title: Firefox won't allow email prompts on webpage; renders site unusable
content:
Some websites prompt users to sign up for email notifications momentarily after arriving on the homepage. I have noticed in Firefox that, on some websites, this notification does not show. However, the background of the webpage is still locked - as though it is still expecting a response on the prompt that is not shown.

For me, this is occurring on TitanFitness.com. As seen in the screenshot, the website greys out and cannot be used. However, the prompt does not show.

I have automatic Firefox updates on, placed this website on popup exceptions, and allowed notifications. None of these solutions work. I'm not sure what other settings in browser could fix this. This website works on other browsers such as Edge and Chrome.
creator: keystone.meyer

title: I got the messege "Warning: Potencial security risk" several times using my new router, what could being wrong?
content:
Hello, i was trying to configurate my wifi using ethernet connection and i got the messege several times even trying to access my provider page and my router page, however it does'nt happend with youtube, some how finally i got to my router page introduced my user id and password, i had to change my wifi antena and try with a a diferent driver but finally got my wifi working. But after that i got for first time in my life a blue screen on Windows 10.

Maybe isn't a big problem but i don't understand what happened, Firefox detected a true risk problem cause the ethernet conncection wasn't safe? Something (a virus or malware) enter my pc? Or was because a internal problem between firefox and a new not configureted router?

Also that messege appear on my android firefox one time.

Thank you and sorry for my english.
creator: fire.of.kaladesh

title: Continually getting certificate errors with Firefox, but none with Chrome, So many that it makes Firefox unusable
content: Continually getting certificate errors with Firefox, but none with Chrome, So many that it makes Firefox unusable. Older version of firefox didn't produce these errors, for the exact same websites. Very frustrating. Tried about 4 different workarounds listed in the community forum, but no luck. Does anyone have an idea? Ideally would just like for firefox to ignore all cert related errors. Or to have a continue button to proceed anyway.
